A total of seventeen Miramare bat boxes installed on trees, D line. Nine bat boxes installed on trees within the lineside between 14.0795 and 14.1431, with eight boxes on 3PL trees adjacent to the railway boundary between 14.1494 and 15.0219.  All boxes a

Multiple sign-posted habitat piles for biodiversity enhancement within the lineside and on 3PL, at a safe distance from the running rail.  Might contain nesting birds, reptiles, amphibians, hedgehogs, other small mammals.  If removal or works on the habit
Interrupter Cable
Black cable protection ducting covering 650v signalling power cable between location case F34/5 to F35/1.  Milages of location cases: F34/5 - 35m 297y / F35/1 - 34m 1499y
Power and telecomms cables across bridge. Gas and water pipes also present. See reference SH000824 and Scottish Power, Transco, West of Scotland Water and Telecomms plans.
S&T cables in down cess and at top of access stairs. See reference SH000830 and "Asset Condition Report".

Drain pipe between tracks, and under track on the up line. Under track crossing. Various cables under and between tracks. Cable route parallel to track on the down side. See reference SH000833 and drawing TRC 348D.

From Main Street Lockerbie, turn Bridge Street then turn right into Park Place. Follow road to right at play area and continue along tarmac road to lock-up garages at rear of houses, and access lineside via metal gate. Walk south along the up cess to th

From Main Street turn into Station Road and follow to the station. Access down platform and cross to up platform via footbridge, then walk north to platform ramp. Cross up loop and walk north via up cess to Ground Frame.~ Node=C001

Large badger sett within dense lineside scrub, likely breeding sett.  Licence required for works within 30m of the sett.

Potential barn owl nesting site on top of the southern abutment underneath the deck.  Large accummulation of pellet debris.  For works within 100m of the structure advice to be sought from Ecology team.
Several gaps between bridge parapet and the wingwalls contain evidence of barn owl presence. Potential nesting sites.  For works within 100m of the structure advice to be sought from Ecology team.

Two old Schwegler 2F bat boxes in mature willow within western section of compound. Confirmed as bat roost on 12.04.2024.  For high disturbance works within 30m, advice to be sought from Ecology team.
Extensive area of Japanese knotweed and buddleia within western section of compound, beyond green mesh fence.
Likely badger breeding sett within lineside 18.0304-18.0334 D, annex sett 18.0349 D on 3PL. Licence required for works within 30m of the setts.  Advice to be sought from Ecology team.
Barn owl box in dilapidated farm building 15m north-west of the railway boundary.  For high disturbance works within 100m of the structure advice to be sought from Ecology team.

From A70 ring road north, turn into Ayr station car park. Walk through ~ entrance on to platform 4. Turn left and walk down ramp to entrance to Apparatus Hut, keeping on path.~ Node=SW023A

From the A79, turn into Woodfield Road. Cross over Oswald Road into Bellrock Road and over OB43. Turn left, and a cess gate is on the left hand side at the next bend. The Apparatus Hut is via the gate, then 20 yards on the left.~ Node=SW021B

From the new road <Ayr> at Tam s Brig, turn into McCalls Avenue, then right into the approach road, through the gate into the vehicle park, thence along the front of the building to entrance.~ Node=SW023A

On the A737 from Dalry, after passing under the railway bridge, turn left at road signposted ~Kersland Farm~. Continue on this road for approximately 0.5 miles, turn left through farm gate before bungalow on right at top of hill. Follow dirt to the rail

From Fort William on the A830 travel to Arisaig, take 2nd turning on right, and follow the road signposted ~Station Car Park~. At station, enter gate to platform. Apparatus Hut is in old station building. <right hand door> Node=W060B

Proceed via factory access road and along the up main line to the signalbox location, thence by sleeper crossing to signalbox. Total warning time required 10 seconds. Minimum sighting distance available 13 seconds. ENSURE LINE IS CLEAR BEFORE ATTEMPTING T
Via gate in Muirhall Road wall adjacent to signalbox Node=W029
From Cowie Road on the down line side to the signalbox via path at side of old station house Node=W029
Node=W059B~ 04/07/2008 This could be removed, providing the Engineers token is taken as per the first requirement. This Section could be walked through alone.

From Loch Awe village on the A85, Apparatus Hut is located 1 mile past the Hydro Electric Visitors Centre on the right hand side of the road. Car parking is possible behind the bollards. Walk 10 yards to compound and through gate to Apparatus Hut Node=W0
Gate behind garages in Kerse Lane~ Node=W018~ Mileage changed by Keith Brown after trackwalk 1/3/02
From Strawfrank Road Carstairs, turn in to the Depot on the down side of OB405, and pass through yard and along dirt track leading to the Ground Frame.~ Node=C002

Travelling east from Lanark on the A70, turn right at Carstairs village into Carstairs Road. Continue on into Station Road and thence to Strawfrank Road. Pass the station entrance and turn left through the yard access. The Relay Room is opposite.~ Node=C0

From Lanark on the A706 heading towards Forth, Apparatus Hut is on the righthand side just before Cleghorn Level Crossing, approximately 2 miles from Lanark. Access is via gate at level crossing. Parking in layby just before level crossing.~ Node=C005

On the A73 between Newmains and Carluke, turn right at Bogside into Wildman Road <B7011>. Continue for approximately 0.5 miles. The Relay Room is accessed via the Field gate on the left hand side, just before the railway bridge.~ Node=C005
On the A74 heading south, take the slip road to the vehicle park at Beattock Summit. Access to the Relay Room is from the car park; turn left and through the wooden gate.~ Node=C001

From M74 exit at junction 13 Abington, follow A702 through village to South end, then turn left into Old Station Road. Follow road to Relay Room compound and access gate to down cess Walk south. along the down cess to OB306, then cross track to up cess a

From the A74 heading south, take the turn off for Abingtoninto Carlisle Road. Take turning on left into Station Road as far as bend in road. The Relay Room is on the left hand side, adjacent to the loop.~ Node=C001
Enter by main gate and cross bridge, along up platform, thence along sidings cess Node=N030
From main entrance through goods yard between down sidings, cross down siding and down and up lines opposite signal box Node=N031
From station via Aberdeen Road, main Aberdeen/Inverness Road towards Inverness, thence Bahill Road, through wicket gate and crossing to signalbox Node=N032
From Keith station along to end of platform 1, thence, between main lines and Dufftown line to No.35 signal, cross main line via pathway along cess to signalbox Node=N033

WATER SUPPLY TO MARSHALLING YARD~ <Ref. Wayleave No 919513001000 >~ Node=W032 6" dia. Scottish Water Main cast iron pipe below track. New concrete protection slab installed. Cover Depth from concrete to underside of sleeper is approx. 727mm. Cover Depth o

Records of the drainage layout although limited are indicative of main runs and are held by the Senior Asset Manager and the Facility Delivery Manager. Contractors should note that drainage exists beneath platforms.
Asbestos hazards please see ARMS for specific details

Within and in the voids beneath the platforms there is the likelihood of the presence of vermin. This is particularly the case in those arches, which are currently unused and contain large amounts of rubbish, thus providing a potential breeding ground. Co
Many panes of glass are missing from the canopy roof and special precautions apply regarding contact with electrical equipment in the presence of water.

Roof above NXEC First Class Lounge. Heating and ventilation system equipment is contained in this area. Wind blown litter and that thrown from the North Bridge above, may accumulate very quickly. There are different floor levels, including access from rai
Basement Room 2, off Bridge Pier Corridor - Boiler room. The room contains boiler, pump and associated pipework and controls.

Basement Room 1, off Bridge Pier Corridor - Boiler House Ventilation Plant room. The room contains equipment and pipework. The floor within this room is uneven. Below the lift there is a void, which should be considered as limited access.

Platform 11, back of Scotrail building <south ramp> - Boiler room. This room houses two gas boilers and associated controls and pipework, much of which is overhead and around walls. The main hazards associated with this area are electrical, water, fire an

Sub-basement, off Bridge Pier Corridor. Houses large pipework giving rise to limited headroom <5’ approx>. This area should be considered as Limited Access/ Confined Space and suitable controls applied.
Basement - HV Substation A <main>. Only authorised persons are permitted entry. The hazards associated with these areas are mainly electrical.

Platform 3/ back of ScotRail operations depot - HV Substations C. This caged area has an uneven floor and the metal floor ducts appear to be 2" approx. deep. Only authorised persons are permitted entry. The main hazards are electrical, tripping and wind b

Basement Room 8, off Bridge Pier Corridor - LV switch room <main>. This room contains numerous cables and pipework. In addition there is a metal floor duct for cables. The main hazard associated with this room is electrical.
North Block Building, first floor - Plant room. There are numerous pipes and cables, and a raised floor level present.
This room contains heating and ventilation equipment. There are discarded machine parts and a switchboard with loose cables exposing wires.
Includes pipework, valves and a raised platform.
The entrance has a raised threshold and there are other raised levels. There are cables, ducts and pipes present within the room associated with the plant.

This room has been used for pistol shooting practice, a charity bicycles store but at the moment it is empty. There are pipes and cables present with high voltage cable of 11 kV present in the room. In addition there are 440v sub mains cables. Within this
Green Disac Fibre Optic cable runs adjacent to the line on both sides of the track.  It is scratch buried on the north side and on the surface on the south side.
